pr_title: JLBP-6: Improving readability with positive wording

timeline.message:
JLBP-6: Improving readability with positive wording

Also, adding descriptions to the cases at the end, otherwise it is
not clear what the cases mean.

timeline.bodyText: can probably diowithout parentheses here and below
timeline.author: elharo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -156,18 +156,18 @@ is to the decision.
 Examples in open source
 -----------------------
 
-**Case 1**
+**Case 1 (Keep same Java package and Maven ID)**

timeline.bodyText: Keep java package the same? "Keep" alone doesn't seem to convey the full meaning
timeline.author: elharo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -70,8 +70,8 @@ Consider the following renaming scenario:
 
 Given this scenario, here are the possible combinations of renamings:
 
-- **Don't rename Java package**:
-  - **Case 1: Don't rename Maven ID**. This approach can result in diamond
+- **Keep Java package**:

replies.bodyText: I changed it to "Keep Java package name", which I hope clarifies it.
replies.author: garrettjonesgoogle

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a noun here? e.g Publish old and new packages with the existing Maven ID
timeline.author: elharo
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -176,5 +176,5 @@ Examples in open source
 - JDOM (org.jdom -> org.jdom2)
 - jdeferred (org.jdeferred -> org.jdeferred2)
 
-**Case 5 (Bundle old and new in the existing Maven ID)**
+**Case 5 - Bundle old and new in the existing Maven ID**
